Name: Goofy's Balloon Party Game
Description: From Whitman and Walt Disney Productions, this 1975 children's game is won by the first player to play all of their balloon discs onto the balloon circles.

Name: Woody Woodpecker's Up the Tree Game
Description: Object of game: To be the first player to follow Woody Woodpecker to his tree house.  Moves made based on spinner result.

Name: Svenska MAD's Götebörsen
Description: Similar to The Monopoly Game and The Mad Magazine Game. Published by the Swedish MAD Magazine department as a supplement in the Swedish MAD Magazine (Svenska MAD) No. 4 1976. It was later reissued as a supplement in Svenska MAD´s stora julpajare 1982.

Name: Highwaymen
Description:
A game where the players are highwaymen in Sweden during the Middle Ages. The players steal from trader caravans and from each other.

A free print and play-version of this game is now available (see files-section below). Now also a version in English.

Name: Deathball
Description:
From the Heresy Miniatures website

"Deathball is a popular gladiatorial pit-fighting variant that is played mainly in the Kingdom of Morica, ruled by Dark Duke Henry the Red, also known by his official title of Duke Scaldis II."

My description:

A game of fantasy mayhem loosely based on football, or maybe some ancient religious game from the Aztecs. Mayhem with miniatures, dice and strategy.

In the same family as Blood Bowl and Futbowel

Rules and board can be downloaded free for personal use at http://www.heresyminiatures.com/deathball.htm

Name: Monopoly: Detroit Tigers Collector's Edition
Description:
From the publisher:

The MONOPOLY Brand is proud to present the 
Detroit Tigers edition of the world's most famous board game. After suffering eleven straight losing seasons, the Detroit Tigers were the biggest surprise in Major League Baseball in 2006, taking home their 10th American League Championship in franchise history, Now Tigers fans can take control of the best ballplayers in Detroit. Buy, sell, and trade Kenny Rogers, Placido Polanco, Magglio Ordonez, Ivan Rodriguez, Carlos Guillen and Manager Jim Leyland in your quest to earn your stripes.

Name: Tiddle Tennis
Description: A tiddly winks variant based on tennis, played on a cloth game board.

Name: Car Wars Deluxe Road Sections Set 1: Starter Set
Description:
This is one of three sets of road sections for Car Wars.  Owning all three parts gives you huge flexibility in laying out regular or "autobahn" style tracks.  Set 1: Starter Set includes 5 double-sided sheets of regular curves, tight curves and straight road sections along with counters.

Expands:

    Car Wars

Name: Playoff Hockey
Description:
A simple game that has a small wooden block with a painted surface that resembles an ice hockey rink as the playing surface, and contains holes for a peg that represents the puck.  Players roll three special dice, one for passing, one for shooting and another face-offs.  Each die has different outcomes displayed on each side.

Players can choose the length of game themselves.

Comes in a clear 4x3 box, and so is good for travel.

Ages 7 and up

Name: Sport Of Kings Challenge
Description:
Sport Of Kings Challenge: The Horse Racing Quiz Game

"4400 questions to entertain followers of the world's #1 spectator sport!"

"A party game! A study guide! A nostalgia trip!"

This horse racing trivia game includes a colorful race track board, 6 plastic horses, 6 plastic tokens, hundreds of trivia question cards, a die, and 6 category cards.

Players answer equine trivia questions as they move their horses around the track.

(c)1986 Kuriakos Inc.

Name: Confrontation
Description:
Confrontation was the name given to the original Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader skirmish game set on Necromunda in which gangs fought against each other, and attempted to increase their prestige and equipment.

The game was published over a number of issues of White Dwarf, starting with Issue 130, and with the last installment in Issue 142.

The mechanics focus on realism, allowing characters to make use of cover in specific ways, and requiring them to make specific tests when under fire.  Actions are performed on a points basis, so a character could run forward and fire a few badly-aimed shots, or stand still and fire more rounds at a target.

The game contains a large amount of detail concerning combat and psychological effects.

Rules for purchasing and trading equipment for players' gangs, were also included.

The game appears to be the precursor of Necromunda, published five years later.

Name: Golden Balls
Description:
A game of luck, intuition and barefaced bluff. You have one simple task - get rid of the "Killer Balls" while keeping the highest value "Golden Balls" in play.
Vote out your opponents in the first 2 rounds (1 round in 3-player play), to make it to the "Bin or Win", and choose your "Golden Five" jackpot balls.
Face your last remaining opponent in a tense head-to-head to "Split or Steal".

Name: Pokerface
Description:
Can you bluff your way to £1million? Based on the hit quiz show, you don't necessarily have to get the questions right to win, you just need to bluff your way through the rounds and pressure your opponents into folding.
You don't have to be the brain of Britain to win, you just have to be clever enough to make them think you are! (taken from back of box)

Players secretly answer 5 multiple choice questions, then try to bluff their opponents into folding a 10second countdown. If no one folds, then the player with the least correct answers loses all their money.

Name: Der goldene Kompass: Die Reise
Description:
Another Franchise to the movie of the same name, this time in the small BMM-Box.
The players move stacks of character tokens and try to reveal certain characters on the finish line, while avoiding the villain

Name: La Mayor Hazaña de la Historia
Description:
This game depicts the events regarding the Discovery of America. It consists of two phases, the first one on land and the second one in the ocean. In the first phase, players must travel to Portugal, visit Duke of Medinaceli and the Prior of the Monastery in La Rábida, among others, in order to get Recommendation Cards to be able to get an audience with the Catholic Monarchs (Reyes Católicos). Once they get support from the Kings, players will buy food provisions, ships, hire the crew and set sail into the unknown...
In the second phase, players will have to sail across the immense ocean in order to discover the New World and be able to bring back the news to Spain.

This game (chosen as the Official Game of the 5th Centennial of the Discovery of America) offers you the possibility to become a Hero (the title translates to "the greatest feat/heroic deed, in history").

The contents of the game are the following:
- Semi-reversible game board
- 70 game cards (Event, 'Self Confidence', 'Recommendation Card', Royal Permission and Pinzón Brothers)
- 6 Columbus pawns
- 42 crew counters (21 and 21 sailors)
- 40 food counters
- 84 Ducat Coins (28 of each 1500, 500 and 100)
- 6 Caravels
- 2 Dice
- Rulebook

Name: Europe Marches
Description: A 1939 wargame that is very rare and (if you can find it) very expensive.  The board features a very colorful map of Europe, with France, Italy, Germany, and England's player areas in the corners of the board.

Name: Federation Commander: Orion Attack
Description:
Orion Attack is an expansion product for the Federation Commander game line.

The nearly final (as of late February 2008) list of ships:
Orion Battle Raider
Orion War Destroyer
Orion Battlecruiser
Orion Heavy Battlecruiser
Orion Double Raider
Orion Slaver
Orion Free Traitor
Commercial Platform 
Large Q-ship
Small Q-ship
Defense Satellites
Hydran Gendarme
Lyran Military Police
Gorn Frigate
Romulan SeaHawk
Monitor

Bonus ships (counters only; ship cards found in the associated boosters): Orion OK6, Orion DN, Orion Heavy Cruiser

Though originally announced as an Origins 2008 release, ADB has indicated that it's now a September 2008 product.

Name: Galáxia S.A.
Description:
From the publisher:

Galáxia S.A. is an exciting game where player will build an intergalactic economical empire! The players will dispute every single piece of the galaxy by acquiring the right to explore planets that produce several goods. These are to be sold at the intergalactic market. But the galaxy is a dangerous place and your opponents will use cunning and intrigue to make your journey harder. Come aboard this adventure and become the most successful cosmic tycoon!

Galáxia S.A. is played in turns that are composed of the following phases:

Action Phase 
Purchase of technology 
Resources Generation Phase 
Exploration Phase 
Planets Auction Phase

With a fresh look and a high replay value, the game will give players hours of fun.

Galáxia S.A. é um emocionante jogo de construção de um império econômico estelar! Os jogadores disputam cada pedaço da galáxia, adquirindo o direito de exploração de planetas que produzem diversos bens e devem vendê-los no mercado intergaláctico. Mas a galáxia é um lugar perigoso, e seus adversários usarão de artimanhas e intrigas para atrapalhar a sua jornada... Então embarque nessa odisséia para tornar-se o mais bem sucedido magnata cósmico!

Galáxia S.A. é jogado em turnos que são compostos pelas seguintes fases:

Fase de Ação 
Compra de tecnologia
Fase de Geração de Recursos 
Fase de Exploração
Fase de Leilão de Planetas

Com um visual inovador e com uma alta rejogabilidade, o jogo proporcionará aos jogadores horas de diversão.


Cosmic Mogul is a non-collectible card game for 3-4 players. During the game, players become cosmic moguls, searching the galaxy for new worlds to exploit as they build their economic empire one planet at a time.

Illustrated by Michael Christopher.
Brazilian Version Illustrated by Marcelo Bissoli

Home Page: http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/galaxia/


Magnata Cósmico é um jogo sobre comércio interplanetário e compra de planetas. Os jogadores podem comprar planetas, negociar bens a comprar tecnologias, criando um império econômico. De 3 a 4 jogadores.

A Arte e o Design/Gráfico por Michael Christopher.
Versão Brasileira Ilustrada por Marcelo Bissoli

Name: Money! Money!
Description:
From Box:
"Build your knowledge of money, how to earn it, and how to spend it in this exciting game!"

Players advance on the board by rolling a die.  Generally at each space the player earns the indicated amount of money, but before collecting, must spin the arrow which often excludes a coin denomination from the payout. The player then takes the earned money from the bank honouring the exclusion. Some special spaces provide a cash windfall or the ability to earn additional money by exchanging coins for higher denomination coins.  Game ends when a player reaches the Finish space and winner is player with the most money.

Educational game aimed at developing children's knowledge of coin money and their ability to perform basic addition.

Canadian version has $1 'Loonie' coins in place of $1 bills.

Name: Irány a játszótér!
Description:
"Irány a játszótér!" means "Let's go to the playground!".
This is a classic Hungarian children's game from the mid 1980s.
It's a simple roll and move game where you have to visit all the games in a playground.

Name: Manók tánca
Description:
Classic Hungarian game from the mid 1980s.
The title in English is "Dance of the Dwarves".

Each players get 4 dwarves in his/her color, and places them in their start places at the middle of the board.
Your goal is to lead your people around the board to the home place of your color with a simple roll and move mechanic.
The catch is that all players' meeples looks exactly like the same (check pictures), because your color is shows only at the bottom of your meeples, so when you're on the move you can easily mix up your people with other players' people. You can check your meeples only at the home site.

Name: Guldgrävarspelet
Description: A very old and rare Walt Disney game, which also have unusual game mechanics for a Disney-game. The players shall collect gold, and also steal gold from each other and try to hide their  own gold.

Name: Det nya Europa
Description: A game published and distributed 1994 by the YES-side during the European Union-referendum in Sweden. Players shall roll the dice and move and then learn about the "new" and the "old" Europe.

Name: Spelet om Amerikas städer
Description: Each player asks another player for a city card, and if he has it he has to hand it over. The goal is to complete as many sets as possible (each set corresponds to a province, and contains a varying number of cities).

Name: Sherlock Holmes
Description: The play of the game is simple and very exciting, and is entirely new. Any number, from 3-8 can take part. The object is to capture as many "burglers", "robbers" and "thieves" cards as possible and to obtain the valuable "Sherlock Holmes" cards. All players play at once and there is never a dull moment. A large part of the fun of the game consists in making a "sweep" by turning up the card "Sherlock Holmes" thus allowing you to quickly seize an opponents pile of cards which would contain the most "robbers", "thieves" and "burglers". Players can also call "Scotland Yard", forcing everyone to pass 3 cards to the player on his left. The first player to 50 points wins the game.

Name: Buster Brown Hurdle Race Game
Description: This is a rare children's game, probably published in the early 1900s.  The cover features some children and animals jumping over hurdles.  The board has a track circling the outside of the board with a picture of a band playing on the green interior of the track.  Also on the interior of the track are four cheering adults, a tepee, and a table set for dinner (with lobster being served).

Name: Speiderpatruljene
Description:
A cardgame for 3-5 players somewhat similair to Elfer Raus, but you have only cards from 1 to 10 in five suits (you use one suit pr. player)  and that you can only play max. one card from your hand each turn.

Together with Cachons (and maybe Stopp), Speiderpatruljen is one of the classic card games from Damm.

Name: Gruftmeister Adventure
Description:
From the publisher's web site:
"The new dimension in dungeon-games

Gruftmeister Adventure says goodbye to dice and chance-oriented fighting-systems. Here you fight the undead with your skill.

Up to four players explore the crypt of count Gramwuml in search for treasure. Behind every door there's fear: Go to the arena and fight. Playing a cryptrunner, thief, fighter or magician, you try to beat the other players. But even when there's no other player, Gruftmeister Adventure can be played as a solo-adventure.

Players start at the skeleton of count Gramwuml. From there they explore the crypt room by room, adding new floor tiles. Use actions to explore the crypt, open doors, fight undead or cast spells. Once you encounter a closed door or a coffin, you go to the arena and fight with your skills. A real challenge for both younger and older players. Finally no more orgies of throwing dice.

Gruftmeister Adventure is a totally new game, you don't need an older version of Gruftmeister. Everything needed for the adventure is included: 18 floor-tiles for all-new adventures every time, 140 cards for monsters, treasures, doors, spells, more than 100 wooden pieces, the fighting arena with all the parts for thrilling duels."

Re-implements:

    Gruftmeister

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Siege of Leningrad
Description:
From the publisher's web page:
For 900 days, German troops ringed the city of Leningrad, trying to capture the Cradle of the Revolution while Soviet soldiers and militiamen fought just as desperately to keep them out. Nazi savagery caused the deaths of well over a million civilians.

Repeated assaults failed, as did Soviet attempts to break the siege. "St. Petersburg," raged Adolf Hitler, "must be erased from the face of the Earth." Not until January 1944 did the Red Army finally drive the Germans back from the city's outskirts.

Siege on Leningrad is a supplement based on the German assaults on Leningrad's defenses, and the Soviet attempts to re-open communications.

Mike Perryman has designed ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that took place along Leningrad's defensive perimeter.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front and Road to Berlin games and Red Warriors and Sinister Forces supplements.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

    Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game
    Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II â€“ A Panzer Grenadier Game
    Red Warriors
    Panzer Grenadier: Sinister Forces

Name: Panzer Grenadier: March on Leningrad
Description:
From the publisher's web site:

March on Leningrad is a supplement based on the German drive to capture Leningrad, and the Soviet defense of the approaches.

Mike Perryman has designed ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that took place south of Leningrad between June and September 1941.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front and Road to Berlin games and Red Warriors and Sinister Forces supplements.

Each scenario has its own card in a spiral-bound booklet, just like the popular North Wind and Alaska's War.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

    Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game
    Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II â€“ A Panzer Grenadier Game
    Red Warriors
    Panzer Grenadier: Sinister Forces

Name: Old Mother Hubbard
Description: Actually a spin and move game from Cadaco from 1954. The game includes a pictorial peg board, a Mother Hubbard spinner and 16 wooden pegs (4 each in 4 different colors)

Name: Monkey's Uncle
Description: Monkey's Uncle from Transogram uses a timer, a spinner and a series of mats that have different tasks that need to be accomplished before the timer runs out. Things like Make a Sound, Build a Tower, Guess Who, Guess What are on cards that are drawn at random and must be accomplished in order to score points. You spin the spinner move to the color mat matching that spin and then try to accomplish the designated task before the timer runs out.

Name: Pre-Emptive Strike!
Description:
Pre-Emptive Strike! is a board game for 2 to 6 players in which each player controls one of the factions warring for control of the desert region of Iraghania. Pre-Emptive Strike! is a tongue-in-cheek look at our world’s current leaders and the problems they can all create.

The Pre-Emptive Strike! download, print, and play game contains over 700 full color tokens, a huge board game map, scenarios, faction tiles, and two full 56 card decks of event cards. All you need to bring to the table are the dice.

Name: Zecken Burger
Description:
From the publisher:

"Nasty ticks in big burgers

Tasty hamburger ingredients are placed on the table. Each player gets four ingredients on his hand and tries to build delicious burgers which get high scores. But hey, what's that? There's a tick between the ingredients. Try to get rid of it as fast as possible. Put it in a burger and hope that no one notices. Fortunately you also can put it in an opponent's burger. But he may give you his burger then and you mustn't refuse that nice 'gift'.
Bluff: Place your ingredients face-down on the table. So no one knows if it's cheese, salad, onions or a little tick. When your opponent gives you that burger, you'll get extra-score. Find the right strategy and the right face-expression to convince your opponents. When the cards are turned face-up, it's getting funny. Tick-Burger is a funny mixture of strategy, chance and bluff for the whole family."

Name: SuDoku: Die Spielesammlung
Description:
SuDoku: Die Spielesammlung is a set of six games which use similar Sudoku-like rules to govern placement of tiles.

In each game, players have identical sets of tiles (numbered 1-9 multiple times) and each turn play one which is randomly drawn. Certain defined sections of the board can only have one of each number in them. When each of certain small sections of the board is filled, the tiles for each player in the section are totaled and points given for first and second place. Bonus points are also given for players who complete larger board sections. The sections which define the placement constraints, regular scoring, and bonus scoring vary from game to game.

The six games are:

1. Classic-SuDoku, played on the standard 9x9 grid.

2. Labyrinth-SuDoku, played on a board divided into nine irregular nine-square sections.

3. Killer-SuDoku, played on a board divided into many small sections.

4. Kakuro, played on a 9x9 grid interrupted by numbered squares. This game can be played two ways - in one version the numbered squares provide an additional constraint and way to earn bonus points.

5. 3D-SuDoku, played on a board which depicts three faces of a cube, giving eight-space rows in three directions.

6. Hexa-SuDoku, played on a board divided into nine regions of nine hexagons each.

Name: Hexpack
Description:
Hexpack is an extrapolation of the piecepack game system, and is basically an expansion to Piecepack, adding hexagonal tiles, as the name suggests. The hexpack is a public domain game system designed to encourage creative, open game development and design.

Additionally, by combining the concept of the hexpack with the concept of the SixPack set of the three red and three black piecepack suits, you end up with six suits, six sides per tile, six ranks of tile and coin, and of course, six sides on each die - as well as a six-sided SixPack suit selection die, if you like.

Name: Black Gold
Description:
From the game bix:


     Purchase leases
     Acquire a rig
     Drill and complete
     Sell oil to create revenue


The roll of the dice and the luck of the draw combined with the skillful movement of your token and keen Wildcat bidding could make you rich in the game of BLACK GOLD. But watch out for the Patch Problems.

For ages 8 to adult

ADDITIONAL note:
The game was created in the small town of Rhein, Saskatchewan Canada. No designer name given.

Box cover has 4 colour photographs of oil well-related scenes. Good board quality. Has look as though it would play along lines of Monopoly mechanics-wise

Name: Taktvoll Punktierte
Description:
An expansion for Taktvoll which adds dotted notes. Contains 112 cards.

Expands:

     Taktvoll

Name: Bohnanza: Spiderbeans
Description:
Expansion for Bohnanza only available with the book "Das grosse Bohnanza Buch" and distributed at the Amigo booth at SPIEL 2015. 
It adds 6 new cards to the game. Three of the Spiderbeans are orange, three are black. With this comes a new way of bluffing when you're trading the Spiderbeans.
When you harvest the SpiderBeans it's not just the number of beans that counts but more the way you planted them.

Expands:

    Bohnanza

Name: Sauve qui poux!
Description:
Sauve qui poux is the third game from young French publisher L'Auberge des Jeux.
(The title is a word play in French that bases on "every man for himself ").

Description by publisher:
Caution: Completely delirious lice unload on an innocent head!

Use with relevance competences of your army - queen, workers, infantry, rifleman and chemists - to keep the supremacy of your colony.

Collect barrels of blood and play your action cards wisely.

Will you be able to lay enough nits and to protect them? Will you manage to occupy the gameboard strategically?
Solo or in teams, take the command of your units and make your adversaries bite the dust.

Name: Vem vet vad?
Description: A card game where players shall say things which starts with a particular letter on a card, that the player before has played. The player has succeeded when the answer is correct or another player is laughing.

Name: Medieval Knights
Description:
A small gift game sold at English heritage sights which feature castles, abbeys or some medieval history,

Game box comes with 5 pewter Knights from different ages in history, games is very basic get from one side of a slim checkered board to the other, one player has 4 figures the other player just 1.

from the back of the box:
This period in history relates to what was is know as the high middle ages, the three centuries between 1100 and 1485. the church was at the center of medieval life and castles where strongholds as well as centers of law and government. In the C11th and the C12th large numbers of knights left England for the religious wars of the crusades to the holy land. by the 1300s more than 1500 castles had been built throughout the land knights had more peaceful interests. Heraldry was the order of the day and the rules of chivalry; Tournaments of Arms and jousting were popular pastimes.

Name: Mix-Match
Description: Mix-Match is a 2-4 player abstract strategy game where players try to clear their own pieces from the 6x6 grid that comprises the game board.  Each player may transpose 2 pieces, then remove a group of orthogonally adjacent pieces of the same color.

Name: IAGO Chess
Description:
IAGO Chess is unique in its nature. The best way to view IAGO Chess is a system used to manage the wide range of interests on the part of people who like to play, and an approach to acclimate new players to the system.
Because of this, you won't find one set of codified rules, as you would with other chess games. The IAGO Chess system accomplishes its objectives by the use of multiple versions (classes) of the game that represent the fullness of the chess experience. These versions build upon one another,
to allow a person to get fully familiar with the game. There are six versions (classes) of the game. These versions are: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, M-Class, V-Class, and X-Class.

This version of chess is more than just a chess variant, it is a system by which chess can integrate variants and evolve.  It has multiple layers and is robust enough to change over time.  Its mission is to be a forever evolving version of chess that will provide a migration path for changes.

It is also meant as a framework for playing all versions of chess relating to the International Abstract Games Organization.

For the actual rules, check out the Chess Variants website:
http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSiagochesssyste

Name: Jack Be Nimble
Description: To be the first player to place all of his candle pieces on the candle holder and then place the flame on the top of the candle.

Name: On the Spot
Description: The book consists of over a thousand moral dilemmas in the form of questions. A turn consists of a player answering a question from the book by secretly voting either 'yes' or 'no'. The other players must try to correctly guess that players' answer. A short discussion is allowed between the other players. Once all other players have made guess, each scores one point if correctly determining the questioned players answer . The player taking the turn will only score one point if there is a majority or equal number of other players that correctly guessed his/her answer.

Name: Killing Machine: Special Forces Supplement
Description:
The Killing Machine: Special Forces Supplement contains additional advanced rules for the Killing Machine miniatures wargame.

This supplement introduces:
Support Fire: On- and off-table support, and Forward Observers
Specialist Troop Types: Special Forces Elite Troops; Snipers; Assault Engineers
Insertion Techniques
New Equipment: Sneaksuits; LAWs; Robot Sentry-Guns

Name: Don't Upset Me
Description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to move any one of his "men" from his home base all around the game field and back to his home base.
Game Components:
Base
Game field
Flippers
Label sheet
Steel ball
Bumpers
Men

Name: Ta & Ge
Description: For two players or more. The goal is to receive as many white pieces as possible. One player selects something on the wheel. The other player doesn't know what the other has selected and has to guess. Among the alternatives are "take two pieces", "give two pieces" and so on. Correct guesses are rewarded and wrong ones punished.

Name: Matrix
Description: In this solitaire cyberspace Piecepack game you move your icebreakers across the ice in search of the four Data Forts. Once located, you have to infiltrate the Forts with the corresponding color icebreaker. Just make sure you don't use all your strength before you have succeeded doing this, or you'll die from brain damage!!!

Name: 15 Minutes Of Fame
Description:
From the publisher:

"Are you ready for your 15 Minutes of Fame? 
 Test your wit and stretch your imagination as creatively-crafted clues are combined to reveal famous secret identities! 
     
When you have the spotlight, how will you reveal your secret identity? You've picked....Arnold Schwarzenegger! Your first challenger might ask, "If you were a food, what type of food would you be?" Your answer could be, "mussels", or, "Weiner schnitzel", or even, "protein drink." The next question might be, "....what type of transportation would you be?" Your answer? How about, "a tank" or "Hummer." Your clues are limited only by your imagination!
 Little by little, clue by clue, other players begin to develop a sense of your identity. 15 Minutes of Fame isn't always easy, but it's always fun, sometimes outrageous, frequently challenging and quite surprising!
 It even includes a few customizable cards for personalized fun! Who knows where this will take you?"

Name: Witchlord
Description:
(From the Introduction to the Witchlord rulebook)

Witchlord is the natural adaptation of fantasy role gaming converted into a board game. There is a distinct advantage to fantasy role gaming from a board; and that is it gets rid of the need for a Game Master or scenario creator. The board, cards and matrix tables contain all the information necessary and the dice determine the outcome of your adventure. No human arbitrator is necessary.

All the passages, rooms, treasure and monsters are randomly generated. This makes no two adventures ever the same. Each time you enter the Witchlord's Castle you can expect a completely different scenario stocked with new treasure and monsters. As the player moves around the board, he will receive information about the configurations of the Witchlord's Castle. This will enable the player to plot his progress on the graph paper given.

The player will choose one of the six Adventure Classes to play. this determines the player's spell and weapon capability.

The player's objective in the game is to collect proficiency points. This is done by the slaying of monsters and the collection of treasure. Encounters and treasure are dictated by the playing cards and matrix tables. When the player reaches the 10th stratum or proficiency level, he must do battle with one of the Witchlord's generals. If the General is vanquished, the the player has won and earned safe passage out of Witchlord's Castle.

The Witchlord Game can be played as a single scenario, or as a campaign game.

Name: Stix
Description:
Stix is a set of:
50 wood rods
4 figures
1 target
1 Game rules with three Games

PICASSO
Think of a word or a term and then lay it with the wood rods

Al CAPONE
The board is made with the wood rods and you have to collect the most of them.

FLIPPER
A dexterity game where you have to hit the target.

Name: Tim LaHaye's Deluxe Bible Trivia Game
Description: Be the first player or team to collect 6 Bible coins by answering questions correctly. Includes 500 cards with 2000 questions.

Name: Ex und stop
Description:
Content:
board, 80 action and question cards, 90 garbage cards, 6 pawns, 1 detour marker, 1 disposing truck, 1 die

Ex and hopp! How easily the banana peel lands in the garbage pail and the old school book in the wastepaper basket.

But here in the game's "Clean-Town" the players are very busy to avoid garbage and to recycle it. Here the motto is "Ex and stop".
The players have the duty to bring the garbage cards to the right disposal locations. The winner is the player who disposed his garbage correctly and is back in his house first.

Name: Bitmoor
Description:
Content: board, 10 pawns, 2 dice

This is the exciting race of two "Bit-Schaften" of 5 bits each across the Bitmoor.
The aim of the game is to reach the opposite side with all 5 bits despite all obstacles and put them together in a row.

Name: Zipher
Description:
Numbered counters valued 1 - 4 are placed upside down on the gameboard. From the middle of the board a pawn is moved according to the number of squares mentioned on the start counter.  An even number makes the pawn land on on counter, an uneven number lets the pawn get next to a counter. The start counter can be removed from the board and is the first gain of the first player. When the pawn lands on a counter, it is turned upside down, then the pawn is placed upon it, so the number becomes invisible. The player must name the right number in his next turn. When he is right the player may take the counter as a win, when wrong he loses a turn. When there are no more counters that can be gained in one turn, the game ends and the player having acquired the highest total when adding the number of the counters won, is the winner of Zipher.
NB the game is a 3 player game.

Name: Parallel Worlds
Description:
The game is a 2 to 4 player trick-taking card game using a deck of 25 custom cards.

From the publisher's website:
Parallel Worlds has a unique playing deck consisting of 25 cards, made up of four 6 card suits belonging to the elements Earth, Air, Fire and Water, plus a Wild card. Each of the suits is also represented by a "House" name that originates from the 1,000's of planets spread throughout space and time.

New Houses will be made available for collection and integration into any starter deck, enabling every player to customize their own deck to their personal taste. Before play commences each player can then select a complete 6 card suit from their own customized deck to represent them as "Temporal Adjuster" within the game.

Name: Big Buck Deer Hunt
Description:
A two to four player game where one player is the "buck."
Players role dice in order to move through the forest in search special places on the board where there will be an opportunity to shoot the buck.
Along the way the hunters will encounter obstacles such as, "Mauled by a bear go back to camp and start over," or "Sprayed by a skunk go back to camp to change clothes"
The hunters win when on of them successfully kills the buck.
The Buck wins by "Must go to feeding station dot (upper center) and through no trespassing zone (upper right), any order, and then return to deer refuge dot (lower left).

Name: Rebels in the White House
Description:
One of the Great Campaigns of the American Civil War series modules.

This one covers Jubal Early's 1864 invasion of Maryland. The game uses the maps from Here Come the Rebels and Stonewall Jackson's Way.

This module is found in The Skirmisher #2.
Families: Series: Great Campaigns of the American Civil War (Avalon Hill/MMP)

Name: Pima Indian Stick Game
Description: This stick game is a traditional game of the Pima Indians of the southwestern part of the US. The 4 sticks each have a pattern indicating a movement option around the track, which is a square with 4 "spaces" on each side. The sticks are cast in the air, and the way they fall determines which movement options the player has for that turn. Basic general rules about movement add some strategy to the order in which these movement options are taken. The first player to go around the track 3 times is the winner.

Name: Day of the Rangers
Description:
DAY OF THE RANGERS is an Ambush Alley scenario pack and rule expansion focused on US military actions leading up to and including Operation Gothic Serpent – a tumultuous period that culminated in the violent and dramatic events depicted in Mark Bowden’s award winning book, BLACK HAWK DOWN.

DAY OF THE RANGERS contains ten scenarios, ranging from historical to cinematic in nature. It also includes ORBATS for US forces, stats for the MH60 Black Hawk and AH6 Little Bird, and new rules that cover such topics as:

Insurgent Forces on Drugs
Mixed mobs: Civilians & Combatant units
Hostile Civilians
Stealthy Units
Suppressed Weapons
Danger Close Fire
Combat Stress
Positive Leaders
Helicopter Ops – Including Fast Rope Insertions and Gun Runs

DAY OF THE RANGERS gives players everything they need to plunge themselves into the hair-raising firefights and desperate heroism that the name “Mogadishu” has come to represent.

Expands:

    Ambush Alley! A Game of Modern Urban Combat

Name: Lock 'n Load: Noville – Bastogne's Outpost
Description: Lock 'n Load: Noville â€“ Bastogne's Outpost  American Riflemen depicts the battle for Noville (12/19-20, 1944) on a verdant 22" x 34" map created from actual maps of the period. There are six scenarios (listed below) and 85 new counters drawn by David Julien, featuring tense battles between American tank-infantry teams against Panzer Grenadiers, Volksgrenediers, and Panzers of the Wehrmacht.  Noville -Bastogne's Outpost is an expansion.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: That 70's Show Spin the Bottle Game
Description: "That 70's Show" Spin the Bottle Game was a promotional game released to FOX television affiliates in 2002.  It contains a board with cast member's faces on which to spin the bottle, along with a bottle of orange Crush bearing a special "That 70's Show" bottle label.

Name: Uncle Lester's Word Game
Description:
Word game based on dictionary definitions. Board is circular with each space designating one of 11 different question categories. Players roll 2 dice, one die determines number of spaces moved, the other the level of question difficulty and point value. First player to 20 points wins the game.

From the box: "Lester Drotts loved wooden toys, games, and Christmas. He began developing this word game in the 80's on his Apple IIC computer and was planning on having it produced for sale. We have put together his brainchild and hope you will learn to love Uncle Lester's Word Game."

Name: Network
Description: Published in Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games", Network is a connection game played on a standard checkerboard. Unlike most connection games, Network doesn't require you to place your pieces next to each other, but only along unobstructed horizontal, vertical or diagonal lines.

Name: Bush Whacked
Description: Players make their way around the board by facing three challenges:  Bush Trivia (Test your knowledge of America's 43rd president), Bushisms (Is it a real quote or a fake quote), and Bushwhacks (These make you go backwards).  The first player to make their way around the board (in whichever direction) and successfully answers a trivia or bushism challenge wins the game

Name: Pomorze 1939
Description:
Pomorze 1939 starts on September 1st 1939 and deals with part of the campaign called Battle of Tuchola Forest. The map represents northern part of Poland - Pomerania.

Since German advantage is huge, polish player is placed in a very defensive role. The game should be played twice - giving opportunity for players to try each side.


Wikipedia: Battle of Tuchola Forest

Name: Pop Corn
Description:
Pop Corn is a fast-playing dexterity game.

In a round, each players pop the popcorns. Popcorn token fall in the table center, and some will  pop, other will not.

Then each player haves 15 seconds to collect the Popcorns on their cards to collect points as fast as they can, but they must be careful, as each useless popcorn gives penalties.

Name: Det Store Indianer-Spil
Description:
Det Store Indianer-Spil (The Great Indian Game) is about gaining control of the opposing player(s) village, by having more Indians in the village than the owning player.

The same goes for the different areas of land, where it is possible to take control of each segment by having more Indians in the segment, denying the opposing Indians access to the area.

The game features both roll and move rules as well as fixed movement rules. The game is also playable with and without cavalry, and with 2-4 players.

Note:
I've investigated this game rather heavily, and as far as I can tell it is from before 1962 (where it appears in a Toy-maker's Guild anniversary catalogue)
However, the publisher no longer exists, and the owner of the publishing toy company died in 1991, leaving little to no traces to follow.

Name: Washington's Wars
Description: These miniature rules also cover the French & Indian War.  The rules also include sample historical battle scenarios, army lists and uniform guides for the British, French and US armies.

Name: Mein erstes Wortschatz-Quiz
Description:
A German card driven game for kids from 6 to 12 years to build up knowledge for German Language Pool of about 3,000 words.

100 cards for German substantives 
34 cards for German verbs
70 cards for German adjactives 
4 empty cards for your own words
80 chips 
1 hour glass
2 dice (a red and a blue one)

It's not only for German kids. Even adults can use it to master proper German. Try it yourself!

Name: Mein erstes Wissens-Quiz
Description:
Educational game for kids from 6 to 12 about knowledge.
Take a card and ask your partner. There are multiple chioce answers given, BUT only one is correct. 
So, use the electronic stick to pick the right answer.

Name: Hannah Montana DVD Game
Description:
From Amazon.com's site:

"The Disney Channel's teen pop sensation Hannah Montana stars in this multi-activity DVD game. Players compete to be the first to make it to the stage and "rock out the show" just like their favorite singer. Along the way, they must earn tokens by winning challenges, which include singing the lyrics to Hannah's songs, posing for the paparazzi, guessing Hannah's fashion sense, and answering questions about the show. The winner will be rewarded with her own karaoke-style spotlight performance. DVD bonus materials include a virtual version of Hannah Montana's Magic 8 Ball. Includes DVD, 3-D game board, die, four movers and 20 tokens."

Name: Warmachine: Legends
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Warmachine: Legends brings the saga of Warmachine to an electrifying climax and provides exciting new options in the form of new warcasters, warjacks, units, solos, and epic warcasters. The book provides all new options for every faction and focuses on the characters, warjacks, and units that have attained legendary status in the world of Warmachine. Warmachine: Legends was released at Gen Con Indy 2008.

Expands:

    Warmachine

Name: Ice Age
Description: Did hunters kill off the last of the mastodons, or was it tuberculosis?  In this single-stash Icehouse game, one player uses the large pyramids (representing the mastodons) and the other uses the small and medium pyramids (representing the cavemen).  The humans surround and kill the mastodons, who must trample the cavemen to survive.  Do the mastodons have a chance?

Name: Lady Bug Fly-a-Way
Description:
First you attach a plain balloon to a nozzle inside a plastic flower. Another flower device acts as a spinner on the top and an air pump underneath. Players spin, count the number of ladybugs showing on the spinner, and then pump it that many times. Each turn inflates the balloon until at a certain point, the balloon is full and suddenly flies off. The one who does this is the winner.

Completely luck-based game from Marx Toys, known for making games involving novelty plastic devices. This particular game is under their label "The Little Entertainers: First Games for the Very Young." The game states ages 4-8.

Name: Naval Wargames World War 1 and World War 2
Description:
Synopsis from the book:
"They are only models and the sea may be any surface which is conveniently at hand, but when the grey warships slip out of port at the start of a game they become something different.  They are German cruisers heading for the Atlantic to prey upon enemy shipping; they are the battleships, carriers and escorts of Force H leaving Gibraltar for another desperate voyage...or an American carrier force off on a long probe towards the Japanese-held islands of the Pacific."--Barry J. Carter

The book covers building or acquiring naval miniatures for table top gaming; also has a set of rules and information for designing your own rules, as well as data for warships from WW1 and WW2.

Name: Tank Battles in Miniature 2: A wargamers' guide to the Russian Campaign 1941-1945
Description:
From the dust jacket:
"Take command of a German Tiger tank or a Russian T-34 through the pages of this book!  It explains how and why the Russian Campaign was fought, describes the vehicles and weapons used, and provides detailed playing suggestions for realistically reproducing the battles on the table top."
Second book in the series, a valuable reference for gamers and game designers.
Families: Series: Tank Battles in Miniature (Patrick Stephens Limited)

Name: Tank Battles in Miniature 4: A wargamers' guide to the Mediterranean Campaigns 1943-1945
Description:
From the dust jacket:
"This, the fourth title in the Tank Battles in Miniature series, deals with Allied and German armoured operations in Tunisia, Sicily, Italy and southern France.  It explains tank usage and tactics, includes valuable data on the weapons and vehicles employed, and contains numerous wargame playing suggestions."
Fourth book in the series, a valuable reference for gamers and game designers.
Families: Series: Tank Battles in Miniature (Patrick Stephens Limited)

Name: Titany Icebreaker
Description: The Titany is sinking. You have to get your passengers into the lifeboats to save them but the order in which the lifeboat is filled is crucial. Play a card out of order and you'll score minus points. The captain and engineer can increase the capacity of any lifeboat and the baby can be put on board a lifeboat at any time. At some time you have to close the lifeboat to more passengers or risk it tipping over. Game comes with German instructions but cards are language-neutral.

Name: Pig Dice
Description:
Game comes with 5 six sided dice in a small plastic tube (similar to what LCR comes in).  Each "1" face on each die is replaced with a picture of a pig.

This is a push your luck dice game similar to Pass the Pigs, where you roll the 5 dice as many times as you want until you want to stop. If 1 pig comes up in a roll it is worth negative 10 points. If 2 to 4 pigs come up, it is the end of the turn with zero points for this turn.  If all 5 dice are pigs, then all of the score for the game is lost and the turn is over.

Name: The Princess Bride
Description:
A promotional board game issued with the Video release of the movie.
The rules are listed on the game board itself, as well as a note that you need to provide your own die and counters.

From the game board:
"Help Westley to rescue the beautiful Princess Buttercup from the evil clutches of the kidnappers.  All you need is a dice, counters and the bravery to outwit the monsters and win the battles in your quest."

A simple roll-and-move game, with the odd square providing bonuses such as "Win the fight with rodents of unusual size.  Go forward 3", and the occasional problems such as "Delayed by torture, go back 3".

Name: Don't Get In A Flap!
Description:
A motorized match up game!
The unique disc-dealer spins, dispensing disc after disc.  Each player has certain shapes on their quarter of the circular game board, and they must try and get all of the discs that fit there shapes before the other players to win.
A little like Perfection on a round board, with more strategy!

Name: Garibaldi. L'eroe dei due mondi
Description: Garibaldi, l'eroe dei due mondi (2 Worlds hero)is a game published in the centenarian of the dead of Garibaldi (1882).  This game has 3 of the less known battles of Garibaldi: Mentana, Digione and Salto di S.Antonio. Every battle has a different map and counters

Name: Drift
Description:
A tactical car-racing game for up to 5 players without any luck! 
Learn to control your cars by following the best line and keeping an eye on your opponents. The mecanics are quite similar to Bolide in how you accelerate and brake the cars.

Comes in an opaque yellow tube with a leatherette playing board.

Name: Würfelpoker!
Description:
Content: 55 question cards,electronical timer with 5 dice with characters,

The turn player reads the word of one card, moves the dice draws to get 5 characters. Each player tries to find as quick as possible many words fitting to the card and starting with one of the dice characters. The player with the most words wins.

Name: Safari Adventure Game
Description:
Safari Adventure Game

Safari provides game players an opportunity to explore wildlife... an adventure filled journey around the world... Teaching about wildlife and geography, Safari has a strong but fun impact for pre-teens through adult..."

Players move around the board answering trivia questions and placing tokens in the back of a little plastic safari truck.

Includes a colorful board, dice, cards, stylized plastic Landrover trucks, score chips, rules, and storage insert.

Name: Team Enduro Motorcycle Race Game
Description:
In this roll and move game each player controls a team of three motorcycles that enter a race in intervals.  Once more than one team motorcycle is on the trail, players choose which one to move forward.  However, motorcycles cannot pass others on the same team. Along the trail motorcycles can encounter breakdowns, various natural barriers, pile-ups and shortcuts.  The first player to get all three motorcycles to the finish line wins.

Equipment:
Game board
Dice
Four sets of three motorcycles (each a different color)
Four color-coded breakdown counters (for tracking lost turns for each motorcycle)
Deck of breakdown cards

Name: Am I a Banana?
Description:
Content: board, 40 cards, 4 pawns and ribbons in 4 colors,

"Am I a donkey? ...Or perhaps a washing machine?"

Which one of the 80 items could you probably be? The player with the mos skillful questions will find it out first and win.  Through different questions come to know which object you have stuck on your forehead with a headband. You must ask one question at a time.

Name: Lauf Schnuffi, lauf!
Description:
Content: 
wooden board, 4 dogs, 1 color die, 1 special die 1-1-2-2-3-blank

The goal of the game is to move as many dogs as possible to the spicey sausage in the finish area.

Name: Guerre à Outrance
Description:
A simulation of small unit (single vehicle) armored combat in France following the German invasion in 1940.

Dana Lombardy, who designed the game, also provides a complete review of the equipment, organization and tactics employed by French, British and German forces in 1940.

Name: Cipher
Description:
Cipher - "A New game with Numbers" - "A real contest of wits"

This game uses an acetate scoring area and crayons so that the scoring area can be used repeatedly.

In a two player game one player plays for even numbers and the other player plays for odd numbers.  Blocks are turned up and plugged into an evolving equation with numbers of the appropriate odd/even type scored by the appropriate odd/even player.

In a four player game players play two on a team for the odd or even side.

Name: High School Musical 2 CD Board Game
Description:
What Time Is it?

It's Summertime! School's out! Move around the board chilling with the High School Musical gang.  The goal is to win the Star Dazzle Award at the Talent Show.  To do this, work hard at your summer job to collect Cast cards. Answer trivia questions and perform fun activities.  If you're successful, clock out from work earning your pay - a treasured Cast card!

Collect 6 different Cast cards and get to the Stage first for the Summer Talent Show.

Name: Hannah Montana CD Board Game
Description:
Get Miley to the concert & Hannah up on stage by collecting stuff that's the "best of both of her worlds."

Objective:  Collect 6 Concert cards and be first to the Stage.  Your fans are waiting.

Name: The Cheetah Girls CD Board Game
Description:
The Fierce Foursome have Growl Power.  They're an unbeatable team on and off the stage.  Now it's time for you to show your spots with your BFF's!  It will be easy-breezy fun for all of you.

Objective:  The Cheetah Girls are challenging you and your friends to collect picture cards of them.  The first player to get 4 different Cheetah Girl cards and return home to her Center Star wins the game.

Name: Peloponnesian War
Description:
Card game for 2 players simulating the Peloponnesian War. One player is Sparta, the other is Athens. Players take turns playing cards. Cards score Victory points, add to your force total, or have special effects. The player with the highest force at the end of a round wins the victory points. The cards include the personalities, land forces, naval forces, allies, and events unique to the conflict. A copy of the rules is available for free at:  
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Pelop.html

Name: Benji Detective Game
Description: Benji turns detective to solve a robbery. Some of his friends have been stolen by dognappers. Valuable coins and jewelry are also missing. Join Benji as he travels around the board searching for clues. Help him find the right cards so that he can locate the robbers and recover the stolen goods. The object of the game is to find 5 cards that match the figures on your clue card.

Name: Pirate's Bounty
Description: Objective:  Be the first player to reach the treasure.  A simple roll and move game with a few action cards and a short cut.  Art and rules signify it as a game for small children.

Name: Satisfaction!
Description: The object is to be the first player to circle the board and land on the red home lens when it is lit.
